Lagu teristimewa untukmu sahabat... [VIDEO]
02 Nov 2019, 21:00 by Amirul Haswendy Ashari



“NIAT saya berkongsi video untuk merakam detik majlis graduasi tamat tingkatan lima anak saya, Muhammad Danish Haiqeal Muhammad Amin,”. Itu luahan ibu Muhammad Danish, Yuslina Rosman, 40, susulan video majlis itu mula tular walaupun sudah dimuat naik ke Youtube pada 29 September lalu.
Pada majlis itu, seramai 93 pelajar tingkatan lima Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan (SMK) Medini Nusajaya menyanyikan lagu Hanya Rindu nyanyian asal penyanyi Indonesia, Andmesh, sebagai penghormatan kepada rakan mereka, Mohammad Shah Luqman Shahrir, 17, yang meninggal dunia dalam nahas jalan raya pada 26 September lalu.
Dalam kemalangan petang Khamis itu, Allahyarham dipercayai terbabit dalam kes langgar lari selepas keluar daripada memotong rambut dan dalam perjalanan ke sekolah untuk menjadi imam solat hajat sempena Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) dan Penilaian Tingkatan 3 (PT3).
“Arwah meninggal dunia tiga hari sebelum majlis dan sepatutnya menyanyikan lagu itu untuk meraikan perpisahan.
“Selepas arwah selamat dikebumikan, guru kelas menghasilkan video untuk ditayangkan pada majlis itu manakala rakan arwah sepakat mahu menyanyikan lagu ini sebagai penghormatan,” katanya.
Ketika dihubungi Harian Metro, Yuslina memberitahu acara persembahan selingan dibatalkan dan digantikan dengan tahlil dan bacaan doa.
Lebih menyentuh hati, Yuslina mendedahkan arwah menyimpan sekeping potongan doa yang mahu dibacakan pada majlis itu.
“Doa itu akhirnya dibaca ketua kelas dan mengandungi doa untuk kesejahteraan ibu bapa, guru dan rakan.
“Majlis hari itu bertukar suram dan semua rakan arwah menitiskan air mata kerana terkenangkan sifat mulia arwah,” katanya.
Setakat ini, video amatur dimuat naik Yuslina mendapat lebih 514,000 tontonan dan 1,500 komen daripada warganet.
“Saya takut orang salah faham seolah-olah saya nak meraih simpati. Saya hanya nak kongsi detik anak. Itu saja.
“Lagi pun, saya bukan seorang ‘Youtuber’, tak tahu kenapa video itu boleh tular,” katanya.


ALLAHYARHAM Muhammad Shah (kiri) bersama Muhammad Danish sebelum maut akibat langgar lari.

A special song for you best friend ... [VIDEO]
02 Nov 2019, 21:00 by Amirul Haswendy Ashari



"I WANT to share a video to record the graduation ceremony of my son, Muhammad Danish Haiqeal Muhammad Amin,". It was revealed that Muhammad's mother Yuslina Rosman, 40, was following the video of the event after it was uploaded to YouTube on September 29.
At the event, 93 students from Medini Nusajaya Primary School (SMK) Elementary School sang the song Just Rindu by Indonesian singer Andmesh in honor of their friend Mohammad Shah Luqman Shahrir, 17, who died in a road accident on 26 Last September.
He was believed to have been involved in a hit-and-run accident after leaving hair cutting and going to school to serve as a prayer priest in conjunction with Certificate of Education Malaysia (SPM) and Form 3 Assessment (PT3).
“The ghost passed away three days before the ceremony and was supposed to sing the song to celebrate the farewell.
"After the funeral was buried, the class teacher produced a video for the event while the bandmates agreed to sing the song in honor of it," he said.
When contacted by Daily Metro, Yuslina said the interruption show was canceled and replaced with tahlil and prayer readings.
More heartfelt, Yuslina revealed her spirit holding a piece of prayer that she wanted to read at the event.
“The prayer was finally read by the class president and contained prayers for the well-being of parents, teachers and friends.
"The ceremony turned out to be gloomy and all the spirit friends shed tears because they were captivated by the dignity of the soul," he said.
To date, amateur videos uploaded by Yuslina have received over 514,000 views and 1,500 comments from the public.
“I'm afraid people misunderstand as if I want to gain some sympathy. I just want to share a second. That's all.
"After all, I'm not a 'Youtuber', I don't know why the video is contagious," he said.


ALLAHYARHAM Muhammad Shah (left) with Muhammad Danish before his death due to a hit-and-run.
